glsa.title: ClamAV: Multiple vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities in ClamAV may result in the remote execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: Clam AntiVirus is a free anti-virus toolkit for UNIX, designed especially for e-mail scanning on mail gateways.

description.p: An integer overflow has been reported in the "cli_scanpe()" function in file libclamav/pe.c (CVE-2008-0318). Another unspecified vulnerability has been reported in file libclamav/mew.c (CVE-2008-0728).

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user or automated system to scan a specially crafted file, possibly leading to the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running ClamAV (either a system user or the "clamav" user if clamd is compromised).

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
